audio_transcript: Where did he find the inspiration for his famous speech? There are countless theories surrounding this. It has been suggested that he drew parallels between the rhythms of jazz and the cadence of his speeches. Furthermore, a young African American artist, Clara Johnson, was known for her vibrant paintings that depicted the struggles of the civil rights movement. During a gathering in Atlanta, King was captivated by her artwork, which featured powerful imagery of hope and resilience. He later incorporated elements of her artistic vision into his speeches, emphasizing the importance of unity and strength in the face of adversity. His famous phrases were not only inspired by literature but also by the rich cultural tapestry of African American art and music.

She claimed that the Chinese government covered up the outbreak and that it had paralyzed Wuhan. RFI reported that Zhang was quickly arrested by the Chinese police and was subsequently sentenced to four years in jail in May 2020 for 'disturbing crimes.' In prison, Zhang frequently went on hunger strike to protest the government's sentencing and mistreatment of her. One of her former lawyers revealed that he met Zhang in winter 2020. At that time, Zhang was very emaciated. A food tube was forced into her nose. Her hands were tied, so Zhang could not pull the tube out.

title: Is the KP.2 variant prevalent in China? It has been discovered for the first time in 2 months  Due to its higher transmissibility, the KP.2 variant of the new coronavirus (COVID-19) is spreading rapidly in various countries. Chinese officials recently admitted that 25 cases of the KP.2 variant had been detected in Guangdong Province alone, marking the first acknowledgment of its presence in China two months after its discovery. This revelation has sparked widespread interest, with the topic "KP.2 mutant strains prevalent in China" gaining attention. The KP.2 variant was first detected in local cases in Guangdong on March 11. Between March 11 and May 12, 25 KP.2 sequences were found among local cases in China. The proportion of KP.2 in weekly reported local cases ranged from 0.05% to 0.30%, indicating a very low level.

audio_transcript: Did you know that several animal welfare charities are urging the public not to attend the new puppies and yoga sessions that have hit Dublin? You may have seen a few posts doing the rounds on Instagram about a new Dublin based yoga event where puppies are allowed to roam the studio freely while this seems cute and harmless. Multiple animal welfare organizations have urged the public not to buy any tickets to these events, citing concerns about the origins and the well being of the puppies involved, posing as an undercover breeder, the animal welfare organization, my lovely horse rescue, conducted an undercover investigation into where the puppies were being obtained for the Dublin based yoga puppy events. A representative from the charity told us it was so easy to get the organizers to agree to use them as breeders. They told us that they didn't offer to check the facilities and they didn't ask any questions about the mother of the pups, which they told us is super important if you're ever buying a puppy that you need to know the condition that the mother was in. The sessions caused forty four ninety an hour. The first 30 minutes are dedicated to yoga with a trained yoga instructor and the puppies are allowed to roam around freely. The second half is dedicated to relaxing and cuddling and playing with puppies. The location of the event changes each time and ticket holders receive Information about the venue a few days before the session. According to the puppies in yoga Dublin website. In response to the concerns about the lack of background checks, Henry Saigon, the owner of the company told us the bad press is always interesting. They're doing this to get views and clicks, because their audience is declining. We're fully booked for 3 weeks in advance. It means that people absolutely love the concept and he denied all of the allegations. In response to the controversy, my lovely horse rescue has created my lovely horse yoga. The sessions are held with dogs from their shelters and it aims to raise money and bring awareness to the dogs that are in dire need of homes. Dog breeding is estimated to be worth around 187 million euro in Ireland. But there's still a huge portion of dogs in Ireland that are in desperate need of re homing.

title: Imagine being just a child and hearing the words that would change your world forever.You can't play with them anymore! A youngMartinLutherKingJr. experienced the harsh reality of racism before he even fully understood what it meant. THOUGHTS
audio_transcript: I just wanted to explore the world outside, but my parents had other plans. They said, 'You can't go out there anymore!' I was confused. I just wanted to ride my bike and enjoy the sun. My friends were all outside, laughing and playing, but I was stuck inside. 'You need to focus on your studies,' they insisted. I tried to explain that I just wanted a little fun, but they didn't understand. 'You can play later,' they said, 'but right now, it's time for chores.' I felt trapped, like a bird in a cage, longing for freedom. I just wanted to join my friends, but the rules kept me from it. 'Why can't I just have one day to be a kid?' I wondered. But they were firm, and I had to obey. So, I sat by the window, watching the world go by, wishing I could be out there too.

This tradition began with George Washington, who stepped down after two terms. It continued until FDR ran for a third term in 1939 during WWII, leading to the 22nd amendment's creation to prevent future third terms. Could Trump overturn this amendment? It requires a two-thirds vote in Congress or a constitutional convention called by two-thirds of state legislatures, followed by ratification from three-fourths of the states, a lengthy process. title: The EPA's disposal process for lithium ion batteries in the LA fires
audio_transcript: Lithium ion batteries are found in many devices, from phones to electric vehicles, and can be dangerous when damaged in disasters like wildfires. Maribel Gonzalez reports on how the EPA is managing the cleanup. In California, wildfires destroyed thousands of buildings, leaving behind hazardous waste, including lithium ion batteries, with the EPA expecting over 500 tons. These batteries can reignite weeks after fires are contained. After collection, EPA technicians soak them in brine to de-energize. Larger packs are dismantled, releasing individual batteries that may emit toxic gases. This process, developed during the 2023 Hawaii wildfires and refined in 2025 California fires, is now critical for future disaster responses.

subject: 2024 Paris Olympics
title: 7,000 rooms and a post office: Inside the Paris Olympic Village • FRANCE 24 English
audio_transcript: The Olympic village is ready to open after five years of preparation, just in time for the games. Although athletes won't arrive for two weeks, journalists are touring the facilities. There are 7,000 rooms with cardboard beds and gyms equipped with 1,800 fitness machines. Training areas include basketball courts set up in former film studios. The village hosts nine sports, providing a place for athletes to train and relax, with cafes and a small supermarket. A post office is available for sending letters and gifts home, complete with a counter and a traditional yellow mailbox. The French athletes' complex is near health services and dining halls, serving 40,000 meals daily with diverse options. The largest themed restaurant focuses on Asian cuisine, seating 900 athletes. To promote sustainability, transport is electric, and while most restaurants lack air conditioning, fans and geothermal cooling are provided. Some teams opted for portable air conditioning units to ensure comfort.

subject: 2024 US presidential election
title: Trump responds to Biden pardoning his son, Hunter
audio_transcript: This morning, President Biden is traveling to Angola after a family holiday on Nantucket, briefly stopping in Washington to announce he is pardoning his son, Hunter. Hunter was convicted of lying about his drug use on a gun purchase form and agreed to plead guilty to tax charges. Biden claims these charges were instigated by political opponents to undermine him. This decision marks a reversal from his previous stance. The pardon extends beyond Hunter's charges to include offenses he may have committed from January 1, 2014, to December 1, 2024. A Republican committee chair accuses Biden of avoiding accountability, while Democratic Representative Greg Stanton criticizes the decision, stating Hunter was convicted of felonies. Biden is not the first president to use his pardon powers before leaving office; Clinton and Trump also granted pardons. In response, Trump questioned if Biden's pardon for Hunter includes the January 6th hostages, reiterating his campaign promises. Trump has vowed to pursue political enemies and plans to replace FBI Director Christopher Wray with ally Kash Patel, who supports his retribution plans. As a father, Biden likely felt compelled to protect his son, who faced significant prison time. Hunter stated he will not take this decision lightly and will focus on helping others in need. Christiane Cordeiro, ABC News, Washington.

title: Space X’s First Civilian Spacewalk Undertaken By Polaris Dawn Crew | 10 News First
audio_transcript: Four civilians have made history 700 kilometers above Earth by completing the first-ever private spacewalk. This achievement usually requires decades of training for astronauts, but it brings hope for more everyday people to venture into space. The Polaris Dawn crew, non-astronauts, undertook this risky mission funded by billionaire Jared Isaacman, primarily to test new space suits and study the effects of space radiation on the body. Since its launch, the Crew Dragon capsule has circled Earth six times, traveling 1,400 kilometers into space, the farthest since the Apollo missions. Now, with history made, it's time to return home. Samara Gardner for 10 News First.
